page.title: 03THE PEOPLE OF YANWORTH
page.content: { Yanworth is mentioned in the first {Domesday Book}but the name is probably Anglo-Saxon / Old English _ meaning "Geana's Word" or "lamb enclosure". Yanworth was recently described in a local newapaper as "a small sleepy village where time seems to have stood still for centuries", and in one guide book as "a small sleepy village".{In {the 1981 census unemployment was zero and the open air life far from sleepy. {Census night}(April 5 1981) saw 66 males and 55 females as the usual resident population and 7 visitors, (total 128). The 1971 figure was 137. Most Cotswold parishes are either increasing with housing developments etc. or decreasing with movement to towns etc. {The preponderance of tied {cottages offering security while in {work and in retirement probably helps {explain this population stability.
